content.title: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana - Short Term Training
content.department: Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
content.beneficiary: Candidates of Indian nationality who are school/college dropouts or unemployed
content.details: The Short-Term Training (STT) component is expected to benefit candidates of Indian nationality who are either school/college dropouts or unemployed. It provides training according to the National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF) and includes soft skills, entrepreneurship, financial and digital literacy. Upon successful completion, candidates receive placement assistance.
benefits: Training in Soft Skills, Entrepreneurship, Financial and Digital Literacy
One-time incentive to all certified candidates
eligibility: Possesses an Aadhaar card and an Aadhaar linked bank account
Fulfils other criteria for the respective job role as defined by the awarding body
content.application_process: Offline - Interested candidates can contact the nearest Training Center to apply.
documents_required: As required for the job role

faqs.question: What will be the coverage of Accidental Insurance?
faqs.answer: Every certified candidate will be provided with three-year accidental insurance (Kaushal Bima) of Rs. 2 lakhs.

faqs.question: What are the job roles for which training are offered?
faqs.answer: There are 332 job roles from various sectors under which training is offered for this scheme.

faqs.question: How can a training provider participate in short term training (central component) in PMKVY 3.0?
faqs.answer: The target allocation under centrally sponsored centrally managed (CSCM) component of short-term training (STT) PMKVY 3.0 will be done in two phases.
